New Records: Messi scored his 109th international goal, moving him closer to Ronaldo's record of 130
Key Match Events: Argentina defeated Canada 2-0 in the Copa America semifinal
Julián Álvarez scored the opening goal in the 22nd minute
Messi scored his first goal of the tournament in the 51st minute after Enzo Fernández's shot
Argentina extended their unbeaten streak to 10 games
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina fans celebrated in Times Square and other locations ahead of the match
The match was played on a temporary grass surface at MetLife Stadium
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni emphasized the importance of continuing to win
Messi referred to the match as 'last battles' and expressed pride in the team's achievements
Canada coach Jesse Marsch highlighted the challenges faced by his team and the need for more player development
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alphonso Davies limped off the field after a challenge, with hopes he would be okay
The match saw significant attention from fans and media, including watch parties in Toronto
Others: The victory moved Argentina closer to a record 16th Copa America title
Messi's leadership and agility were noted during the match
